author: ryandotsmith
content:
Hello, while I understand this might not be the proper place to ask, I'm wondering if anyone can point me in the right direction for the following question:

How is it possible that a transaction receipt can contain a log with non-empty data and an empty list of topics.

author: ryandotsmith
content:
> A log entry, O, is a tuple of the loggerâ€™s address, Oa, a possibly empty series of 32-byte log topics, Ot and some number of bytes of data
I found this in the yellow paper. So it seems that it's just a possible case to be handled. Never mind :)

author: _shemnon
content: Hand coded assembly too.  Solidity would at least populate one of the topics.

author: ryandotsmith
content:
Yes, that's what I expected. Here's an example transaction with logs and no topics:
https://etherscan.io/tx/0x4490f830719452f1ae88628cfc31d155b6263d7eb33fa0b5bcbd570f8ae28ab7

author: 0xkitsune
content:

 https://www.evm.codes/playground?callValue=0&unit=Wei&callData=0x60016000526001601ff3&codeType=Bytecode&code=%2736z803736zzF06040z8080~1945AF1~114%27~600z~0%01z~_
